latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

item.title: To authorize the Secretary of the Army to posthumously award the Distinguished Service Cross to William D. Owens for his valorous actions from June 6, 1944, to June 8, 1944, during World War II at La Fiere Bridge in Normandy, France, while serving with the 505th Parachute Infantry.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.title: Pharmaceutical Risk Assessment and Mitigation Act of 2024

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

Committee on Armed Services. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Reed. With written report No. 118-188. Additional views filed.

bill.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to Senate for portions of this bill
item.title: Military Construction Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to Senate
item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025

A bill to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2025 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 433.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
